items.title: A Second Lawsuit Accuses Tyler Perry of Sexual Assault
items.description: Mario Rodriguez, who had a role in one of Mr. Perry’s films, sued him on Thursday, months after another actor filed a similar lawsuit.

items.title: New York Receives Its Heaviest Snowfall in Nearly 4 Years, Disrupting Flights
items.description: Central Park got more than four inches of snow for the first time since January 2022, with higher totals outside New York City.

items.title: How Oil, Drugs and Immigration Fueled Trump’s Venezuela Campaign
items.description: New details of deliberations show how aides with overlapping agendas drove the United States toward a militarized confrontation with Venezuela.

items.title: ADHD drugs may work indirectly to boost attention
items.description: Drugs like Adderall and Ritalin appear to help children with ADHD by activating brain areas involved in alertness and motivation.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia Reach Cease-Fire in Brutal Border War
items.description: The 72-hour cease-fire could pave the way for an end to the fighting, which has killed dozens and displaced thousands over nearly three weeks.

items.title: In Myanmar, the Election Is Called Fake, but the Human Suffering Is Real
items.description: A coup set off a brutal civil war and made a poor country poorer. Now its military rulers are seeking a veneer of legitimacy by holding elections.
